plants.name: Rosa spp.
plants.description: Roses are iconic flowering shrubs known for their fragrant, showy blooms. In temperate regions, many rose varieties bloom profusely in early to midsummer, including July. They are widely cultivated but also found in wild forms.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late spring to mid summer (May to July)
plants.funFact: Roses have been used for over 5,000 years for their beauty, fragrance, and symbolic meanings in cultures around the world.

plants.name: Nelumbo nucifera
plants.description: The sacred lotus is an aquatic perennial plant famous for its large, fragrant flowers that rise above the water surface. It typically blooms in summer months under warm climates.
plants.location: Asia (India, China, Japan), tropical and subtropical wetlands
plants.funFact: The lotus flower folds its petals at night and reopens them at dawn, symbolizing rebirth and purity in many Asian cultures.

plants.name: Alcea rosea
plants.description: Hollyhocks are tall biennial or short-lived perennials prized for their tall spikes lined with multiple blossoms. They bloom heavily in midsummer and are common in cottage gardens and wild along roadsides.
plants.location: Native to Asia and Europe; cultivated worldwide in temperate zones
plants.funFact: Hollyhocks can grow up to 8 feet tall and attract many pollinators like bees and butterflies.
